channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Large broken branch resting precariously on branch below, 8th August
item.description:
From Shurdington Road entrance to Chargrove Lane on right hand side after the first bungalow and before Oak Farm. Leaves are dead and brown. Branch snapped off main trunk and could fall into the lane
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chargrove Lane, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large dip in road forming, 7th August
item.description:
Large dip in the road forming, outside 131 Gloucester Road. has increased in size. Generates Loud noise when traffic travels over.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 123, Gloucester Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.title: Rubbish Dump, 7th August
item.description:
Back of Greenways estate, storage building next to pedestrian exit onto Barrett Way. Rubbish dumped in building with no care or attention, lots of items that should be taken to a tip. Door open and rubbish strewn onto path both sides of pedestrian entrance. Hazard to pedestrians and bikes, likely to attract vermin.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Barnett Way, Barnwood, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Grass verge dug up by Openreach, 7th August
item.description:
A utility company (Openreach) has recently dug up the grass verge from the telegraph pole opposite Number 17 Newcourt Road down toward the corner of Chestnut Walk. As shown in the photo the grass verge has not been properly re-laid and almost certainly cannot be cut in it's present state.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15, Newcourt Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Path/Way doesn't match map problem, 7th August
item.description:

item.title: Why were the trees cut down in whitehall lane as theres no access to severn trent, 7th August
item.description:
Mrs Hazel Rees is enquiring why the trees were cut down in Whitehall Lane as there is no access to Severn Trent.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayden Green, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain obstructed and water is washing away a dip in the road, 7th August
item.description:
The drain next to Birdlip View is obstructed by overgrown verge. Water coming down the hill has been bypassing the drain and following the road around to the left which goes down a lane to Ruby's. The water is washing away the highway in front of our property entrance from the highway, creating a dip which is causing vehicles to ground their front and rear as they enter and exit our property. The water is also washing debris from the road down the lane to Ruby's. The issue has been present since we moved in at the start of July 2024. The verge needs to be cleared from around the drain to encourage water to go down it, AND the dip in the highways in front of our entrance needs to be filled in with tarmac to raise back up to being level with the adjacent highway and remove the severe dip which has been created. Tarmac is needed rather than loose chippings because chippings will be washed down the lane.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ermin Way, Birdlip, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet
